content: धर्मः [ध्रियते लोकोऽनेन, धरति लोकं वा धृ-मन्; <ab>cf.</ab> <ls>Uṇ. 1. 137</ls>] {@--1@} Religion the customary observances of a caste sect, &c. {@--2@} Law, usage, practice custom, ordinance, statute. {@--3@} Religious or moral merit, virtue, righteousness, good works (regarded as one of the four ends of human existence); <ls>Ku. 5. 38</ls> and see त्रिवर्ग also; एक एव सुहृद्धर्मो निधनेऽप्यनुयाति यः <ls>H. 1. 65.</ls> {@--4@} Duty, prescribed course of conduct; षष्ठांशवृत्तेरपि धर्म एषः <ls>Ś. 5. 4</ls>; <ls>Ms. 1. 114.</ls> {@--5@} Right, justice, equity, impartiality. {@--6@} Piety, propriety, decorum. {@--7@} Morality, ethics. {@--8@} Nature, disposition, character; <ls>Māl. 1. 6</ls>; प्राणि°, जीव°. {@--9@} An essential quality, peculiarity, characteristic property, (peculiar) attribute; वदंति वर्ण्यावर्ण्यानां धर्मैक्यं दीपकं बुधाः <ls>Chandr. 5. 45</ls>; <ls>Pt. 1. 304.</ls> {@--10@} Manner, resemblance, likeness. {@--11@} A sacrifice. {@--12@} Good company, associating with the virtuous. {@--13@} Devotion, religious abstraction. {@--14@} Manner, mode. {@--15@} An {%Upaniṣad%} <ab>q. v.</ab> {@--16@} <ab>N.</ab> of Yudhiṣṭhira, the eldest Pāṇḍava. {@--17@} <ab>N.</ab> of Yama, the god of death. {@--18@} A bow. {@--19@} A drinker of {%Soma%} juice. {@--20@} (In <ab>astrol.</ab>) <ab>N.</ab> of the ninth lunar mansion. {@--21@} An {%Arhat%} of the Jainas. {@--22@} The soul.
